alert.note: Alert for Comanche (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 01 at 12:11AM CDT until June 01 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT FOR COMANCHE COUNTY... At 1211 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Boone to near Fort Sill to near Geronimo, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters measured a 67 mph wind gust in Lawton. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Cache, Elgin, Geronimo, Fletcher, Sterling, Medicine Park, Fort Sill, Meers, Lake Lawtonka, Lake Ellsworth and eastern Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
